Class Grid

  • java.lang.Object
    • Grid

  • public class Grid
extends java.lang.Object
    Denver Quane ID#101611184 CS-351 last Rev. 2/15/17 This class handles all of the logic and drawing for the board representation of Conway's Game of Life

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Grid.MouseEventTypes
      Clarifies to the board whether a received mouse event was a left, right, or a dragging click

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Grid()
      Default constructor does NOT initialize the board structures when it is created, and is required to be called later

      Loads the checkerboard preset

      Sets the dimensions of the board grid, +2 in each dimension to account for the empty, un-updated buffer cells on the borders

      • setDims

        public void setDims(int rows,
                    int cols)
        Sets the dimensions of the board grid, +2 in each dimension to account for the empty, un-updated buffer cells on the borders
        Parameters:
        rows - Row (y) size of the grid
        cols - Column (x) size of the grid

        Moves the camera to a position on the board
        Parameters:
        cellrow - row coordinate
        cellcol - column coordinate

      • setThreadAmt

        public void setThreadAmt(int threads)
        Specifies the number of threads to update the board with
        Parameters:
        threads - Number of threads

      • drawToCanvas

        public void drawToCanvas(javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas canvas)
        Receives the canvas to be drawn to, and proceeds to draw the board according to what the camera object can see of the board
        Parameters:
        canvas - The canvas to be drawn to
        See Also:
        Camera

      • startThreads

        public void startThreads()
        Starts the threads used to update the board, along with a cyclic barrier to swap the old and new boards when they have been updated completely

      • updateThreadGrid

        public void updateThreadGrid(int startRow,
                             int endRow)
        Updates the entirety of the game board based on the start, and end rows provided. This is to allow for all threads to call the same function, with their own regions of "responsibility" for updating on the board
        Parameters:
        startRow - The starting row for a given thread to start updating from
        endRow - The last row that a thread should update for it's region

      • handleMouseEventAtCoords

        public void handleMouseEventAtCoords(Grid.MouseEventTypes type,
                                     int x,
                                     int y)
        Handles mouse events from the camera depending on their type and location
        Parameters:
        type - Mouse event type, whether it be left, right, or a drag click
        x - pixel x location of the mouse event
        y - pixel y location of the mouse event

      • toggleFlagAtCellCoords

        public void toggleFlagAtCellCoords(int cellRow,
                                   int cellCol)
        Toggles a flag at a cell coordinate location
        Parameters:
        cellRow - Row coordinate of the cell to toggle
        cellCol - Column coordinate of the cell to toggle

        Parameters:
        num - Number of times to update the board before stopping
